reviews.review_msg: Do not take classes with him if you value organization. There was no due dates in the syllabus, he does not respond to emails often or correctly. The guest lectures are not useful. He is very disengaging with materials.
Very good class on the specifics of urban public policy in Vancouver. With guest lecturers and lots of class discussion. Great 4th year seminar class!

Took this class online. Unclear guidelines on all assignments. Was difficult to reach regarding questions. Course was unclear and dense. There were no lectures, discussions or guideance of any type. Truly dissapointing.

do not take this class online - unclear criteria for all assignments, very very little feedback which provides little to no help on future assignments, outdated and seemingly irrelevant readings that are dense and a very "do-it-yourself" structure for the course. Very little is done to aid your understanding, just take pol100

Textbook was dry, his lectures were dry, and his power points were poorly organized (some were in document form). However, the professor was nice and he tried to make jokes. Overall, not a difficult class (it is an introductory course after all) but could have been made easier with better study material.
Textbook was very difficult to read. Assignments were fair. Final wasn't that bad, lots of essays

Paddy was an amazing prof! His lectures were a bit confusing as he'd go off topic quite a bit, but the content's all available on his powerpoints (posted online) and his textbook. His exams were just essays and he'd give you the questions to study prior. Homework was really easy - 1 group presentation + 1 memorandum (paper). You can do well easily.

His lectures are really long and dry. Tutorials help a lot, so don't skip those. His grading for the midterm, memo, and final is rather easy. You just have to study and you should be able to do alright.
Extremely nice. Very passionate and generally funny. Not a difficult class, but the content can be a bit dry at time. Converse shoes are a must.

He is a very nice person but quite difficult to understand in class because he mumbles. He had a lot of guest speakers which are hit and miss. The textbook is essential but it needs a few rereadings for you to get everything.

A very nice man and a good professor. Read the textbook several times until you really understand and listen to his examples in lecture and you will do well. He's a fair marker and very funny. Also does a great job bringing in guest speakers.

The textbook material is twenty years old. Kind of felt ripped off paying so much for a course that was so outdated. Update the text book AND the study guide, otherwise, students aren't really learning anything relevant.

Took this class Distence Education.  Textbook is absolutely horrid and dry...material is boring as hell.  Also, no communication with the prof at all, and assignment questions were vague.  Take this class only if it's mandatory.
DE - TEXTBOOK SUCKED. ONLY TAKE THIS CLASS IF IT IS MANDATORY. ITS SIMPLE WORK BUT THE TEXTBOOK SUCKED AND HE ISN'T VERY CLEAR WHEN U ASK HIM QUESTIONS!

I found Paddy Smith to be a very engaging and approachable professor. and because of his passion for the subject matter he was able to give that back to his students. He has a great sense of humor ( always wearing hightops and shorts). his textbook could use some editing however.
Fabulous professor, and extremely helpful. Great with students who actually seek him out in office hours. Nice guy.

Took this class DE. Marks based on 5 500 word and 1 1500 word papers. The essay questions were often confusing and unclear. He was non-existent. However, his TA Agnes was very helpful and sent out an outline of EXACTLY what she wanted. His text is horrendous to read and outdated. If you listen to Agnes, you should do fine. I ended up with an A+.

His handwriting is terrible and he does not make sense when he comments back on your work. For an intro course his grading is difficult and he doesn't like too much detail in his essays which doesn't make sense. I would rate this teacher from a scale of A-F, a C.
The text IS a pain to read. But you need it to succeed. Take key facts from each chapter and memorize it. He is a very fair and kind prof.
FOR THE LOVE OF GOD PADDY, PLEASE CHANGE THE TEXTBOOK. Clearer handwriting wouldn't hurt either.

Man this class was bad. Seems like a great guy but as a prof he's terrible. Textbook is confusing as hell as are his lectures. Not necessarily because of the material but because of the way each (the text and lectures) have been laid out.
Good man, Terrible text book. very frustrating for a 600 dollar university course. His text book looks like my scribbles.

This guy knows his stuff, but does not know how to write a textbook. The book is a piece of crap only suitable for the purposes of using as firewood. Communication in DE is lacking also. Burn his book.

Took this course through DE. The prof seems really caring and knowledgable. However, his textbook is an absolute mess. 400 pages of size 10 plain text. The text does little to help you understand the material and runs on and on and on with examples which at the end, is near impossible to show clarity to what he meant to say. Stay away from 151.
Took distance education. Excellent Prof. Really cares about helping you and making sure you do well. I would highly recommend him. He is just an great person.
distance ed course, VERY boring and confusing...textbook is useless and jumbled...prof wrote it himself..i would NOT recommend this course unless you ABSOLUTELY need it...tough marker as well

Notorious for wearing shorts and bright green Converse hi-tops no matter what the weather conditions. A relaxed, self-deprecating sense of humour and a LOT of appreciation/interest in esoteric Canadian political subjects that I strongly suspect the majority of his first-year students do not share- but a good man and a fair professor.

Paddy is a very friendly professor.  POL 151 material is quite dry, but Paddy manages to make the information much more interesting.  The textbook is a bit difficult to read, but it is a MUST read for this course.  He gives out exam questions in advance so you prepare and do the questions in advance you will ace the exam. Tutorials are nice too.
He is totally incomprehensible, very passionate about the material but very confusing to understand and to make matters worse he wrote the text... :S
No Comments

I took 151 by distance. I actually had a lot of fun though the text is quite hard to understand. Since it was by distance we had a course guide which sorta clarified the text. Also, Paddy seems really nice I only met him on the day of the final and i sorta wished i could have taken the in person class instead.

Paddy seems like a really nice guy, but taking this course Distance Ed. is not recommended.  The only feedback from him is written in most cases and totally illegible.  Also, apparently if you take the course on-campus you get the exam questions ahead of time.  No fair!
He is a good guy and he very care his student..on marking, u at least get C+ even u write something BS on Assignmet. But his textbook is very messy...

I took this class by Distance ED. What a mistake. Paddy is cool guy in person. I like his attitude. He is a bit of a hard marker in DE tho. The worst part was his textbook. Its a peice of crap. Its way to detailed for intro. Also the writin in it is terrible. The font made it feel like my eyes were bleeding. FORTHELOVEOFGOD, CHANGE YOUR BOOK PADDY!

Textbook is expensive, in Arial Narrow size 9 font and reads like a long-winded optical illusion, HOWEVER, Paddy is a gem. He is extremely helpful, knows his subject well, and has great connections for internships!

He knows what he's talking about and is interesting enough so u better listen in lecture. And pay attention in tutorials!!! His textbook is a mixed bag of run on examples and actual facts so it's impossible to understand. Nice guy but i got more out of Cat in the Hat than his text.

The text was the worse ever. I ended up reading 4 chapters only, gambling that 3 of them will be on the final exam(i was lucky!lol)I didnt find the lectures helpful.Paddy is knowledgable, but he expects it's difficult to follow the contemporary issues he blabbers on abt when you actually know nothing.

Distance Ed-I would not recommend. Since there are no lectures,your source of knowledge is his textbook.Awww his dreadful textbook.It seems like he wrote randomly-just like a bunch of journal entries.The is no logical flow to his written style.His marking is very tough.My main problem with this course is the TEXTBOOK.I'll use it as firewood!

One of the best professors I have ever had! Extremely helpful and clear about what is going to be on exams. (He gives u half the questions ahead of time!) Text is dry, however the lectures are what u need to pay attention to in order to do well on exams. Gives real examples, good teacher. If u pay attention u will do well, I recommended this course

last half of the course after the mid-term is dreadful. You cannot answer essay questions for the final thoroughly with the text or class notes. the book is dreadful and his exam questions are hard to answer if u were refer to the text. good teacher, helps alot, and style and pace of the course was not good

His story telling was okay, his lectures were okay too.  Tests were fair, not too easy or to hard but are all essays.  The textbook however is absolutely dreadful, 400 pages of 10 point font and all words; that should say it all.  If you want to do well, you're going to have to pay attention in lecture, that is if you don't fall asleep.
If I wanted to give away my tuition money to struggling comics I would...this class is a mess, text is incredibly sloppy (written by him), I would stay away unless it's a pre-req.
THe rotating sneaker colors where hilarious. THe text was rather dry but could be applied quite well to the tests. Very fair with letting you know what was on each exam. Tutorials where the greatest
Good prof, knows his stuff, lot of interest, helps students out a lot. Field trips!

A very helpful prof, who is very knowledgeable. He has a peculiar but amusing sense of humor and is quite personable. Fashion sense appears to be lacking, but it definitely is entertaining for students.

good-natured professor, w/ a great sense of humor. Lectures are not straightforward, a little unclear with funny digressions--can get annoying at times when you just want to learn something, and he's trying to entertain instead. But overall, good course.
Whats up with the multiple varieties of technocolour sneakers?
nice guy, great field trips
if you enjoy paying $600 to learn absolute nothing and being bored out of your mine then take his class
The bestest most smartest person I have ever met or seen anywhere.  One word, WOWWY.
The textbook was so boring I wanted to cry. I didn't really like the class, but at least his exams were structured fairly.

the lectures were boring and slow. the text was confusing and disjointed and poorly written. best part was the fact that exam questions were given out a week ahead of the exam. if not for my great ta, this course would've been unbearable.
Boring Lectures. Expects alot from students. He wrote the text and it is very unclear. BUT he gives the questions for the final before hand so it makes things alot easier.
Paddy is by far the best prof i have had at SFU. He manages to take any material and make it interesting. HE'S FABULOUS. (and who can go wrong with red cons and shorts - all year round!!)

If it wasn't for his technocolour shoes, half the class would have slipped into a coma.  Enjoys making jokes, and being the only one to laugh at them.  Managed to get two pretty hot TAs, though.  That must count for something.
his book sucks!
The text isn't that helpful and confusing at times but he's a great prof. Actually made class interesting with his sense of humour.
Awesome. Very cool guy. One of my best profs in 3 years at SFU
text sucks. never understood anything in lectures so it was a waste of time. essay based exams & gave questions to the final exam beforehand.
great professor.  book sucks though.
his handwriting on feedback on assignments is illegible. his textbook is pathetic. it has over 150 typos and editing errors. it's a disgrace.
What can I say? I've taken his course before, and I'd take it again if I could.
awesome!! he's always funny in class or after class.  always wear shorts & a pair of converse
Paddy is so old school!  Awesome prof, always wears shorts, funny!
very interesting class, and fair assignments / tests, plus he's so nice / funny!
text sux~!! he's certainly a nice prof.
This man is hilarious. Easy class..Definately recommend taking!
Great Prof. Great Guest Lecturers.
funny, text sucks, lectures are good. love the sneaks
Good prof. Gave exam questions prior to exam. can't ask for any more
Funny guy, wears the same funny outfit every week. Tells good stories
No Comments
Great jolly fellow.  Funny!!!  Easy marker.
Love his classic All-Stars sneakers! A real jolly fellow.
Santa?
I love how he wears shorts in the winter... good prof
Evaluation of Submitted Work is Brutal!  Lectures well done, text needs editing!
Exams are difficult
Great guy; wears shorts in the snow and always makes you chuckle.
